title: Audit and centralize all type/interface definitions
description:
## Context
Student type fragmentation was discovered during sm-8yf implementation. Multiple conflicting Student interfaces existed across the codebase:
- src/lib/studentPermissions.ts (with full_name)
- src/app/(admin)/users/siswa/actions.ts (with name)
- src/app/(admin)/users/siswa/types.ts (StudentBiodata)

This caused runtime errors and type mismatches.

## Solution Implemented
Created centralized types at src/types/student.ts with hierarchy:
- StudentBase ‚Üí StudentWithOrg ‚Üí StudentWithClasses ‚Üí StudentBiodata
- All modules now import from central location

## Task: Comprehensive Type Audit

**Scope**: Search entire codebase for similar type fragmentation patterns

**Areas to Audit**:
1. **User/Profile types** - Check for duplicate UserProfile definitions
2. **Class/ClassMaster types** - Verify single source of truth
3. **Meeting types** - Check for meeting type duplicates
4. **Organization types** (Daerah, Desa, Kelompok) - Verify consistency
5. **Attendance types** - Check AttendanceLog definitions
6. **Report/Rapot types** - Verify single source
7. **Material types** - Check for duplicates

**Checklist**:
- [ ] Grep for "interface Student" and "type Student" across src/
- [ ] Grep for "interface User" and "interface Profile"
- [ ] Grep for "interface Class" (exclude CSS classes)
- [ ] Grep for "interface Meeting" and "type Meeting"
- [ ] Grep for duplicate org types (Daerah, Desa, Kelompok)
- [ ] Grep for "interface Attendance"
- [ ] Check if types should live in src/types/ or stay local
- [ ] Create centralized types where needed
- [ ] Update CLAUDE.md with type centralization rules
- [ ] Document type guidelines in src/types/README.md

## CLAUDE.md Update Required

Add section: **Type/Interface Guidelines**

**Rules**:
1. ‚úÖ **Centralize shared types** in src/types/ directory
2. ‚ùå **Never duplicate type definitions** across files
3. ‚úÖ **Use type hierarchy** (Base ‚Üí Extended ‚Üí Full) for complex entities
4. ‚úÖ **Re-export for backward compatibility** when moving types
5. ‚úÖ **Name consistently**: UserBase, UserWithRole, UserProfile (not User1, User2)
6. ‚ö†Ô∏è **Local types OK** for: Component-specific props, form data, internal state
7. ‚ö†Ô∏è **Centralize types for**: Database entities, API responses, shared business logic

**Example Hierarchy**:
```typescript
// src/types/student.ts - Central location
export interface StudentBase { id, name, gender, status }
export interface StudentWithOrg extends StudentBase { org fields }
export interface StudentFull extends StudentWithOrg { all fields }

// Other files import, don't redeclare
import type { StudentWithOrg } from '@/types/student'
```

**Check Before Creating Types**:
- Search codebase: "interface MyType" OR "type MyType"
- If exists ‚Üí import it, don't recreate
- If needs extension ‚Üí use extends, don't copy-paste

**Migration Strategy**:
1. Create src/types/[entity].ts with centralized definitions
2. Update imports in all files
3. Keep old file with re-exports for backward compatibility
4. Add deprecation comment pointing to new location

## Success Criteria
- [ ] All duplicate types identified and documented
- [ ] Centralized types created where appropriate
- [ ] All imports updated to use central types
- [ ] TypeScript compilation passes with no errors
- [ ] CLAUDE.md updated with type guidelines
- [ ] src/types/README.md created with examples
- [ ] Tests pass after refactor

title: Student management - Hard Delete and Transfer History
description:

Database Considerations:

title: Feature: Student management actions (Archive, Transfer, Soft Delete, Hard Delete) with teacher permissions
description:
## Overview
Implement student lifecycle management with approval-based transfer workflow. Students can be archived (graduated/inactive), transferred with approval system, and deleted (soft/hard) with role-based permissions.

## üéØ Key Features

### 1. Archive Student (with Status)
**No approval needed** - Immediate action

### 2. **Transfer Student (Approval-Based Workflow)** ‚≠ê NEW APPROACH
**Cross-boundary transfers allowed with approval system**

### 3. Soft Delete (Restorable)
**No approval needed** - Immediate action

### 4. Hard Delete (Permanent)
**Superadmin only** - No approval needed

---

## üîÑ Transfer Workflow (Approval-Based System)

### Core Principles:
1. ‚úÖ **Can request transfer anywhere** (no hard boundaries)
2. ‚úÖ **Auto-approved if within same organization scope**
3. ‚úÖ **Needs approval if crossing organizational boundaries**
4. ‚úÖ **Reviewer must have authority over destination organization**
5. ‚úÖ **Support bulk transfers** (multiple students in one request)

### Transfer Rules:

| Scenario | Auto-Approved? | Reviewer Needed? |
|----------|---------------|------------------|
| Same Kelompok (class change only) | ‚úÖ Yes | ‚ùå No |
| Different Kelompok, Same Desa | ‚úÖ Yes | ‚ùå No |
| Different Desa, Same Daerah | ‚ùå No | ‚úÖ Admin Desa (target) |
| Different Daerah | ‚ùå No | ‚úÖ Admin Daerah (target) |
| Superadmin transfer | ‚úÖ Yes (bypass) | ‚ùå No |

### Request Status Flow:
```
[Created] ‚Üí pending
    ‚Üì
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí Auto-approved (same org) ‚Üí approved ‚Üí executed
    ‚îÇ
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚Üí Needs approval (cross-boundary) ‚Üí pending
            ‚Üì
            ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí [Reviewer: Approve] ‚Üí approved ‚Üí executed
            ‚îÇ
            ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí [Reviewer: Reject] ‚Üí rejected (can re-submit)
            ‚îÇ
            ‚îî‚îÄ‚Üí [Requester: Cancel] ‚Üí cancelled
```

---

## üóÑÔ∏è Database Schema

### New Table: transfer_requests
```sql
CREATE TABLE transfer_requests (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
  
  -- Students being transferred (supports bulk)
  student_ids UUID[] NOT NULL, -- Array of student IDs
  
  -- Source organization (current)
  from_daerah_id UUID REFERENCES daerah(id),
  from_desa_id UUID REFERENCES desa(id),
  from_kelompok_id UUID REFERENCES kelompok(id),
  
  -- Destination organization (target)
  to_daerah_id UUID REFERENCES daerah(id),
  to_desa_id UUID REFERENCES desa(id),
  to_kelompok_id UUID REFERENCES kelompok(id),
  to_class_ids UUID[], -- Optional: specific classes to assign
  
  -- Request metadata
  requested_by UUID REFERENCES profiles(id) NOT NULL,
  requested_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
  reason TEXT, -- Required for cross-boundary transfers
  notes TEXT,
  
  -- Approval workflow
  status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending' 
    CHECK (status IN ('pending', 'approved', 'rejected', 'cancelled')),
  
  reviewed_by UUID REFERENCES profiles(id),
  reviewed_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
  review_notes TEXT,
  
  -- Execution
  executed_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
  executed_by UUID REFERENCES profiles(id),
  
  -- Audit
  created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
);

CREATE INDEX idx_transfer_requests_status ON transfer_requests(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_transfer_requests_students ON transfer_requests USING GIN(student_ids);
CREATE INDEX idx_transfer_pending_target ON transfer_requests(to_daerah_id, to_desa_id, to_kelompok_id) 
  WHERE status = 'pending';
CREATE INDEX idx_transfer_requester ON transfer_requests(requested_by);
```

### Update: students table
```sql
ALTER TABLE students
  ADD COLUMN status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'active'
    CHECK (status IN ('active', 'graduated', 'inactive')),
  ADD COLUMN archived_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
  ADD COLUMN archived_by UUID REFERENCES profiles(id),
  ADD COLUMN archive_notes TEXT,
  ADD COLUMN transfer_history JSONB DEFAULT '[]'::jsonb;
  -- deleted_at already exists

CREATE INDEX idx_students_status ON students(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_students_archived ON students(archived_at) WHERE archived_at IS NOT NULL;
```

### Update: profiles table
```sql
ALTER TABLE profiles
  ADD COLUMN permissions JSONB DEFAULT '{
    "can_archive_students": false,
    "can_transfer_students": false,
    "can_soft_delete_students": false
  }'::jsonb,
  ADD COLUMN notification_badge JSONB DEFAULT '{
    "pending_transfer_requests": 0
  }'::jsonb;

CREATE INDEX idx_profiles_permissions ON profiles USING GIN(permissions);
```

---

## üìã Implementation Tasks

### Phase 1: Database & Permissions (Priority: High)
- [ ] Migration: `transfer_requests` table
- [ ] Migration: `students` status fields
- [ ] Migration: `profiles.permissions` JSONB
- [ ] RLS policies for `transfer_requests`
- [ ] **TDD**: Write tests for permission utilities ‚úÖ DONE
  - `canRequestTransfer()` ‚úÖ
  - `canReviewTransferRequest()` 
  - `needsApproval()`
  - `isOrganizationInUserHierarchy()`

### Phase 2: Transfer Request Server Actions (Priority: High)
- [ ] `createTransferRequest(studentIds, targetOrg, reason)`
  - Auto-approve if `needsApproval() === false`
  - Create pending request if needs approval
  - Update notification badge for target admin
- [ ] `approveTransferRequest(requestId, notes)`
  - Validate reviewer has authority
  - Execute transfer (update `student.daerah_id`, etc.)
  - Update `student.transfer_history`
  - Clear notification badge
- [ ] `rejectTransferRequest(requestId, notes)`
  - Mark as rejected
  - Clear notification badge
  - Allow re-submission
- [ ] `cancelTransferRequest(requestId)`
  - Requester can cancel pending requests
- [ ] `getPendingTransferRequests(userId)`
  - Get requests awaiting user's review
- [ ] `getMyTransferRequests(userId)`
  - Get requests created by user

### Phase 3: Archive & Delete Actions (Priority: High)
- [ ] `archiveStudent(studentId, status: 'graduated'|'inactive', notes)`
- [ ] `unarchiveStudent(studentId)`
- [ ] `softDeleteStudent(studentId)` (update existing)
- [ ] `restoreStudent(studentId)`
- [ ] `hardDeleteStudent(studentId, confirmToken)` (superadmin only)

### Phase 4: UI Components (Priority: Medium)
- [ ] `TransferRequestModal` (NEW)
  - Select destination (no restrictions on dropdown)
  - Bulk student selection
  - Reason field (required if cross-boundary)
  - Preview: "Auto-approved" vs "Needs approval from X"
- [ ] `PendingTransferRequestsSection` (NEW)
  - List requests awaiting review
  - Approve/Reject buttons
  - Show student details, reason, requester
- [ ] `TransferRequestHistoryModal` (NEW)
  - Show request status (pending/approved/rejected)
  - Timeline view
- [ ] `NotificationBadge` (NEW)
  - Show count of pending requests
  - Click ‚Üí navigate to requests section
- [ ] `ArchiveStudentModal`
  - Status selector (graduated/inactive)
  - Notes field
- [ ] Update `DeleteStudentModal`
  - Soft delete confirmation
- [ ] `HardDeleteConfirmDialog`
  - Superadmin only
  - Type DELETE confirmation

### Phase 5: Notification System (Priority: Medium)
- [ ] In-app notification badge (no email)
- [ ] Update `profiles.notification_badge` on request creation
- [ ] Clear badge on request review
- [ ] Real-time updates with Supabase Realtime (optional)

### Phase 6: Testing (Priority: High)
- [ ] Unit tests for permission utilities ‚úÖ DONE (38 tests)
  - `canArchiveStudent()` ‚úÖ
  - `canTransferStudent()` ‚úÖ (need to update for new workflow)
  - `canSoftDeleteStudent()` ‚úÖ
  - `canHardDeleteStudent()` ‚úÖ
- [ ] Unit tests for new approval functions
  - `canRequestTransfer()`
  - `canReviewTransferRequest()`
  - `needsApproval()`
- [ ] Integration tests
  - Auto-approved transfer flow
  - Approval-required transfer flow
  - Bulk transfer (5 students at once)
  - Rejection and re-submission
  - Archive/unarchive
  - Soft delete/restore
  - Hard delete cascade

---

## üéØ Success Criteria

‚úÖ Admin can request transfer to ANY organization (no dropdown restrictions)
‚úÖ Transfers within same org are auto-approved (immediate)
‚úÖ Cross-boundary transfers create pending request
‚úÖ Target admin receives in-app notification badge
‚úÖ Target admin can approve/reject with notes
‚úÖ Rejected requests can be re-submitted
‚úÖ Bulk transfer (multiple students) in single request
‚úÖ No expiration on pending requests
‚úÖ Archived students hidden from active lists
‚úÖ Soft deleted students can be restored
‚úÖ Hard delete requires superadmin + double confirmation
‚úÖ Full audit trail in `transfer_requests` and `transfer_history`

---

## üö® Edge Cases

1. **Student already has pending transfer** ‚Üí Show warning, allow cancel old request
2. **Request for deleted student** ‚Üí Not allowed, must restore first
3. **Reviewer deletes their account** ‚Üí Request stays pending, other admins at same level can review
4. **Student enrolled in multiple classes** ‚Üí Transfer updates org but keeps class enrollments (admin must manually update)
5. **Bulk transfer with mix of statuses** ‚Üí Show which will auto-approve vs need approval
6. **Requester cancels after reviewer approves** ‚Üí Cannot cancel approved requests
7. **Destination org gets deleted** ‚Üí Request auto-cancelled with notification

---

## üìä Database Queries Examples

### Get pending requests for reviewer
```sql
-- Admin Desa viewing requests targeting their desa
SELECT tr.*, 
       array_agg(s.full_name) as student_names,
       p.full_name as requester_name
FROM transfer_requests tr
JOIN profiles p ON tr.requested_by = p.id
JOIN students s ON s.id = ANY(tr.student_ids)
WHERE tr.status = 'pending'
  AND tr.to_desa_id = :user_desa_id
  AND (:user_role = 'superadmin' OR tr.to_daerah_id = :user_daerah_id)
GROUP BY tr.id, p.full_name
ORDER BY tr.requested_at DESC;
```

### Update notification badge
```sql
-- Count pending requests for user's org
UPDATE profiles
SET notification_badge = jsonb_set(
  notification_badge,
  '{pending_transfer_requests}',
  to_jsonb((
    SELECT COUNT(*)
    FROM transfer_requests
    WHERE status = 'pending'
      AND to_desa_id = :user_desa_id
  ))
)
WHERE id = :user_id;
```

---

## üîó Related Beads

- Depends on: Database schema design
- Blocks: UI implementation
- Related: User permissions management

---

## üìù Notes

- **Breaking change** from original plan: Transfer boundaries are now request-based, not hard restrictions
- Existing `canTransferStudent()` tests need update to new `canRequestTransfer()` logic
- Consider adding `transfer_requests_history` table for long-term audit (archive old completed/rejected requests)
- Future: Add batch approval (approve 10 requests at once)
- Future: Add delegation (admin can delegate approval authority to another admin)

title: Bug: DataFilter layout for 3 filters not aligned properly for admin desa
description:
## Problem
When admin_desa users view pages with DataFilter showing 3 filters (e.g., Kelompok, Kelas, Jenis Kelamin), the layout is not properly aligned. The filters appear in different rows with inconsistent widths.

## Current Behavior
- All 3 filters appear on separate rows
- Filter widths are not equal
- Layout looks messy and unprofessional

## Expected Behavior
- 2 filters on top row (equal width)
- 1 filter on bottom row (full width on mobile, equal width on desktop)
- All filters should be aligned and have consistent spacing

## Location
File: src/components/shared/DataFilter.tsx
Lines: 570-598

## Current Code Issue
Line 576 uses `grid-cols-2 md:grid-cols-4` for filterCount 2-4, which doesn't handle 3 filters properly.
The `getFilterClass` function attempts to fix this with col-span, but the base grid is incorrect.

## Attempted Fix (Reverted)
Changed line 576 to separate cases:
- filterCount === 2: grid-cols-2 md:grid-cols-4
- filterCount === 3: grid-cols-2 md:grid-cols-3
- filterCount === 4: grid-cols-2 md:grid-cols-4

But this was reverted by linter/prettier.

## Solution Needed
Need to implement proper grid layout for 3 filters that:
1. Works on mobile (2 cols, last spans 2)
2. Works on desktop (3 equal cols)
3. Survives linter/prettier formatting

---

title: Unit tests for student management server actions
description:
Write unit tests for server actions in management.ts to ensure transfer workflow correctness.

Test Coverage Needed:

1. createTransferRequest()
   - Test auto-approval for same organization transfers
   - Test pending status for cross-boundary transfers
   - Test duplicate request detection (same student, same target, pending)
   - Test bulk transfer (multiple students)
   - Test permission validation
   - Test invalid target organization

2. approveTransferRequest()
   - Test actual student data update (org fields, class_id)
   - Test status change to approved
   - Test reviewer permission validation
   - Test class assignment (with and without classes)
   - Test student_classes junction table update
   - Edge case: Request already processed

3. rejectTransferRequest()
   - Test status change to rejected
   - Test reviewer permission validation
   - Test student data unchanged
   - Edge case: Request already processed

4. cancelTransferRequest()
   - Test status change to cancelled
   - Test requester permission validation
   - Test only pending requests can be cancelled
   - Edge case: Non-requester tries to cancel

5. archiveStudent() / unarchiveStudent()
   - Test status updates (active <-> graduated/inactive)
   - Test permission validation
   - Test student visibility in queries

6. restoreStudent()
   - Test deleted_at cleared
   - Test permission validation
   - Test soft-deleted student restored

Testing Strategy:
- Use MSW (Mock Service Worker) to mock Supabase responses
- Create mock data fixtures for students, requests, organizations
- Test both happy path and error cases
- Verify database mutation calls
- Check permission logic integration

Setup Required:
- Install msw package

1. Student in Kelompok A enrolled in Remaja A class
2. Transfer to Kelompok B without selecting class
3. Bug: Student still shows class_id from old org
4. Expected: Student has class_id = null

Root Cause:
- approveTransferRequest in management.ts does not update class_id when no class is selected
- Only updates organizational fields (daerah_id, desa_id, kelompok_id)

Fix Required in approveTransferRequest:
Set class_id to null if classIds array is empty

2. Transfer without class selection (class_id = null)

title: Bug: Data table laporan hilang pertemuan saat multi-class filter
description:
## Deskripsi Bug

**Halaman**: /laporan (Data Table)
**File**: src/app/(admin)/laporan/page.tsx

### Problem
Saat menampilkan laporan dengan **multiple class filter** (7 kelas sekaligus), jumlah pertemuan yang ditampilkan jauh lebih sedikit dibanding saat filter **single class**.

### Reproduksi
1. Filter laporan dengan **1 kelas saja** (contoh: Kelas 4)
   - ‚úÖ Hasil: Menampilkan belasan pertemuan presensi
   - ‚úÖ Persentase kehadiran per siswa: BENAR

2. Filter laporan dengan **7 kelas sekaligus**
   - ‚ùå Hasil: Hanya menampilkan 1 pertemuan
   - ‚ùå Persentase kehadiran per siswa: SALAH (tidak akurat)

### Impact
- üö® **CRITICAL**: Laporan statistik kehadiran siswa tidak akurat
- Data pertemuan hilang/ter-filter salah saat multi-class selection
- Persentase kehadiran menjadi misleading untuk admin/guru

### Root Cause (Hipotesis)
Kemungkinan bug ada di:
1. **Class filter logic** di `src/app/(admin)/laporan/actions.ts`
   - Multi-class filter mungkin menggunakan logic yang salah (AND vs OR)
   - Bisa jadi filter meeting berdasarkan `student.class_id` bukan `meeting.class_ids`

2. **Data aggregation** di DataTable component
   - Mungkin ada logic yang assume single class only

### Expected Behavior
- Filter dengan 7 kelas harus menampilkan **SEMUA** pertemuan dari ketujuh kelas tersebut
- Persentase kehadiran dihitung berdasarkan total pertemuan yang BENAR

### Files to Investigate
- `src/app/(admin)/laporan/actions.ts` (line ~448-467: class filter logic)
- `src/app/(admin)/laporan/page.tsx` (DataTable rendering)
- `src/components/shared/DataFilter.tsx` (multi-select class filter)

### Related to CLAUDE.md
See **Filtering & Reporting Conventions** section:
> When filtering attendance/reports by class, **ALWAYS filter by meeting's class**, NOT student's enrolled class

Line: 165
Current code:
```typescript
label: cls.name,
```

## Expected Behavior
For desa-level users (admin_desa), the class label should include kelompok name:
- Format: "{kelompok_name} - {class_name}"
- Example: "Kelompok A - Pra Nikah" instead of just "Pra Nikah"

For other user levels (superadmin, admin_daerah, admin_kelompok, teacher):
- Keep current behavior (class name only)

## Implementation Notes
1. Check user profile level (isAdminDesa from @/lib/userUtils)
2. Ensure classes data includes kelompok relation
3. Update label conditionally based on user level
4. Test with desa-level admin account
